### Package: dplyr

---

#### Function: `dplyr::select()`

---

**1\.Filter out columns**

Review the data (d1)

```{r, echo=FALSE}

source("data.R")
d1

```

Drop extra1, extra2, extra3

```{r}

d1 %>% dplyr::select(-c(extra1:extra3))

```

You can also drop columns based on column name

```{r}

d1 %>% dplyr::select(-(dplyr::starts_with("extra")))

```

**2\. Keep columns**

```{r, echo=FALSE}

source("data.R")
d2

```

Keep id and test_score

```{r}

d2 %>% dplyr::select(id:test_score2)

```

You can also keep columns based on column name

```{r}

d2 %>% dplyr::select(id, dplyr::contains("test"))

```
